00064 /* Keep a refcount of lov->tgt usage to prevent racing with addition/deletion.
00065    Any function that expects lov_tgts to remain stationary must take a ref. */
00066 static void lov_getref(struct obd_device *obd)
00067 {
00068         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00069 
00070         /* nobody gets through here until lov_putref is done */
00071         mutex_lock(&lov->lov_lock);
00072         atomic_inc(&lov->lov_refcount);
00073         mutex_unlock(&lov->lov_lock);
00074         return;
00075 }
00076 
00077 static void __lov_del_obd(struct obd_device *obd, struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt);
00078 
00079 static void lov_putref(struct obd_device *obd)
00080 {
00081         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00082 
00083         mutex_lock(&lov->lov_lock);
00084         /* ok to dec to 0 more than once -- ltd_exp's will be null */
00085         if (atomic_dec_and_test(&lov->lov_refcount) && lov->lov_death_row) {
00086                 struct list_head kill = LIST_HEAD_INIT(kill);
00087                 struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt, *n;
00088                 int i;
00089 
00090                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "destroying %d lov targets\n",
00091                        lov->lov_death_row);
00092                 for (i = 0; i < lov->desc.ld_tgt_count; i++) {
00093                         tgt = lov->lov_tgts[i];
00094 
00095                         if (!tgt || !tgt->ltd_reap)
00096                                 continue;
00097                         list_add(&tgt->ltd_kill, &kill);
00098                         /* XXX - right now there is a dependency on ld_tgt_count
00099                          * being the maximum tgt index for computing the
00100                          * mds_max_easize. So we can't shrink it. */
00101                         lov_ost_pool_remove(&lov->lov_packed, i);
00102                         lov->lov_tgts[i] = NULL;
00103                         lov->lov_death_row--;
00104                 }
00105                 mutex_unlock(&lov->lov_lock);
00106 
00107                 list_for_each_entry_safe(tgt, n, &kill, ltd_kill) {
00108                         list_del(&tgt->ltd_kill);
00109                         /* Disconnect */
00110                         __lov_del_obd(obd, tgt);
00111                 }
00112         } else {
00113                 mutex_unlock(&lov->lov_lock);
00114         }
00115 }

00117 static int lov_set_osc_active(struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *uuid,
00118                               enum obd_notify_event ev);
00119 static int lov_notify(struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_device *watched,
00120                       enum obd_notify_event ev, void *data);
00121 
00122 int lov_connect_obd(struct obd_device *obd, __u32 index, int activate,
00123                     struct obd_connect_data *data)
00124 {
00125         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00126         struct obd_uuid *tgt_uuid;
00127         struct obd_device *tgt_obd;
00128         static struct obd_uuid lov_osc_uuid = { "LOV_OSC_UUID" };
00129         struct obd_import *imp;
00130         int rc;
00131         ENTRY;
00132 
00133         if (lov->lov_tgts[index] == NULL)
00134                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00135 
00136         tgt_uuid = &lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_uuid;
00137         tgt_obd = lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_obd;
00138 
00139         if (!tgt_obd->obd_set_up) {
00140                 CERROR("Target %s not set up\n", obd_uuid2str(tgt_uuid));
00141                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00142         }
00143 
00144         /* override the sp_me from lov */
00145         tgt_obd->u.cli.cl_sp_me = lov->lov_sp_me;
00146 
00147         if (data && (data->ocd_connect_flags & OBD_CONNECT_INDEX))
00148                 data->ocd_index = index;
00149 
00150         /*
00151          * Divine LOV knows that OBDs under it are OSCs.
00152          */
00153         imp = tgt_obd->u.cli.cl_import;
00154 
00155         if (activate) {
00156                 tgt_obd->obd_no_recov = 0;
00157                 /* FIXME this is probably supposed to be
00158                    ptlrpc_set_import_active.  Horrible naming. */
00159                 ptlrpc_activate_import(imp);
00160         }
00161 
00162         rc = obd_register_observer(tgt_obd, obd);
00163         if (rc) {
00164                 CERROR("Target %s register_observer error %d\n",
00165                        obd_uuid2str(tgt_uuid), rc);
00166                 RETURN(rc);
00167         }
00168 
00169 
00170         if (imp->imp_invalid) {
00171                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "not connecting OSC %s; administratively "
00172                        "disabled\n", obd_uuid2str(tgt_uuid));
00173                 RETURN(0);
00174         }
00175 
00176         rc = obd_connect(NULL, &lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_exp, tgt_obd,
00177                          &lov_osc_uuid, data, NULL);
00178         if (rc || !lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_exp) {
00179                 CERROR("Target %s connect error %d\n",
00180                        obd_uuid2str(tgt_uuid), rc);
00181                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
00182         }
00183 
00184         lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_reap = 0;
00185 
00186         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Connected tgt idx %d %s (%s) %sactive\n", index,
00187                obd_uuid2str(tgt_uuid), tgt_obd->obd_name, activate ? "":"in");
00188 
00189         if (lov->targets_proc_entry != NULL) {
00190                 struct proc_dir_entry *osc_symlink;
00191                 struct obd_device *osc_obd;
00192 
00193                 osc_obd = lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_exp->exp_obd;
00194 
00195                 LASSERT(osc_obd != NULL);
00196                 LASSERT(osc_obd->obd_magic == OBD_DEVICE_MAGIC);
00197                 LASSERT(osc_obd->obd_type->typ_name != NULL);
00198 
00199                 osc_symlink = lprocfs_add_symlink(osc_obd->obd_name,
00200                                                   lov->targets_proc_entry,
00201                                                   "../../../%s/%s",
00202                                                   osc_obd->obd_type->typ_name,
00203                                                   osc_obd->obd_name);
00204                 if (osc_symlink == NULL) {
00205                         CERROR("cannot register LOV target "
00206                                "/proc/fs/lustre/%s/%s/target_obds/%s\n",
00207                                obd->obd_type->typ_name, obd->obd_name,
00208                                osc_obd->obd_name);
00209                 }
00210         }
00211         RETURN(0);
00212 }
00213 
00214 static int lov_connect(const struct lu_env *env,
00215                        struct obd_export **exp, struct obd_device *obd,
00216                        struct obd_uuid *cluuid, struct obd_connect_data *data,
00217                        void *localdata)
00218 {
00219         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00220         struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt;
00221         struct lustre_handle conn;
00222         int i, rc;
00223         ENTRY;
00224 
00225         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "connect #%d\n", lov->lov_connects);
00226 
00227         rc = class_connect(&conn, obd, cluuid);
00228         if (rc)
00229                 RETURN(rc);
00230 
00231         *exp = class_conn2export(&conn);
00232 
00233         /* Why should there ever be more than 1 connect? */
00234         lov->lov_connects++;
00235         LASSERT(lov->lov_connects == 1);
00236 
00237         memset(&lov->lov_ocd, 0, sizeof(lov->lov_ocd));
00238         if (data)
00239                 lov->lov_ocd = *data;
00240 
00241         lov->targets_proc_entry = lprocfs_register("target_obds",
00242                                                    obd->obd_proc_entry,
00243                                                    NULL, NULL);
00244         if (IS_ERR(lov->targets_proc_entry)) {
00245                 CERROR("%s: cannot register "
00246                        "/proc/fs/lustre/%s/%s/target_obds\n",
00247                        obd->obd_name, obd->obd_type->typ_name, obd->obd_name);
00248                 lov->targets_proc_entry = NULL;
00249         }
00250 
00251         obd_getref(obd);
00252         for (i = 0; i < lov->desc.ld_tgt_count; i++) {
00253                 tgt = lov->lov_tgts[i];
00254                 if (!tgt || obd_uuid_empty(&tgt->ltd_uuid))
00255                         continue;
00256                 /* Flags will be lowest common denominator */
00257                 rc = lov_connect_obd(obd, i, tgt->ltd_activate, &lov->lov_ocd);
00258                 if (rc) {
00259                         CERROR("%s: lov connect tgt %d failed: %d\n",
00260                                obd->obd_name, i, rc);
00261                         continue;
00262                 }
00263                 /* connect to administrative disabled ost */
00264                 if (!lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_exp)
00265                         continue;
00266 
00267                 rc = lov_notify(obd, lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_exp->exp_obd,
00268                                 OBD_NOTIFY_CONNECT, (void *)&i);
00269                 if (rc) {
00270                         CERROR("%s error sending notify %d\n",
00271                                obd->obd_name, rc);
00272                 }
00273         }
00274         obd_putref(obd);
00275 
00276         RETURN(0);
00277 }
00278 
00279 static int lov_disconnect_obd(struct obd_device *obd, struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt)
00280 {
00281         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00282         struct obd_device *osc_obd;
00283         int rc;
00284         ENTRY;
00285 
00286         osc_obd = class_exp2obd(tgt->ltd_exp);
00287         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%s: disconnecting target %s\n",
00288                obd->obd_name, osc_obd->obd_name);
00289 
00290         if (tgt->ltd_active) {
00291                 tgt->ltd_active = 0;
00292                 lov->desc.ld_active_tgt_count--;
00293                 tgt->ltd_exp->exp_obd->obd_inactive = 1;
00294         }
00295 
00296         if (osc_obd) {
00297                 /* Pass it on to our clients.
00298                  * XXX This should be an argument to disconnect,
00299                  * XXX not a back-door flag on the OBD.  Ah well.
00300                  */
00301                 osc_obd->obd_force = obd->obd_force;
00302                 osc_obd->obd_fail = obd->obd_fail;
00303                 osc_obd->obd_no_recov = obd->obd_no_recov;
00304 
00305                 if (lov->targets_proc_entry != NULL)
00306                         lprocfs_remove_proc_entry(osc_obd->obd_name,
00307                                                   lov->targets_proc_entry);
00308         }
00309 
00310         obd_register_observer(osc_obd, NULL);
00311 
00312         rc = obd_disconnect(tgt->ltd_exp);
00313         if (rc) {
00314                 CERROR("Target %s disconnect error %d\n",
00315                        tgt->ltd_uuid.uuid, rc);
00316                 rc = 0;
00317         }
00318 
00319         tgt->ltd_exp = NULL;
00320         RETURN(0);
00321 }
00322 
00323 static int lov_disconnect(struct obd_export *exp)
00324 {
00325         struct obd_device *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
00326         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00327         int i, rc;
00328         ENTRY;
00329 
00330         if (!lov->lov_tgts)
00331                 goto out;
00332 
00333         /* Only disconnect the underlying layers on the final disconnect. */
00334         lov->lov_connects--;
00335         if (lov->lov_connects != 0) {
00336                 /* why should there be more than 1 connect? */
00337                 CERROR("disconnect #%d\n", lov->lov_connects);
00338                 goto out;
00339         }
00340 
00341         /* Let's hold another reference so lov_del_obd doesn't spin through
00342            putref every time */
00343         obd_getref(obd);
00344 
00345         for (i = 0; i < lov->desc.ld_tgt_count; i++) {
00346                 if (lov->lov_tgts[i] && lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_exp) {
00347                         /* Disconnection is the last we know about an obd */
00348                         lov_del_target(obd, i, NULL, lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_gen);
00349                 }
00350         }
00351         obd_putref(obd);
00352 
00353         if (lov->targets_proc_entry != NULL)
00354                 lprocfs_remove(&lov->targets_proc_entry);
00355 
00356 out:
00357         rc = class_disconnect(exp); /* bz 9811 */
00358         RETURN(rc);
00359 }
00360 
00361 /* Error codes:
00362  *
00363  *  -EINVAL  : UUID can't be found in the LOV's target list
00364  *  -ENOTCONN: The UUID is found, but the target connection is bad (!)
00365  *  -EBADF   : The UUID is found, but the OBD is the wrong type (!)
00366  *  any >= 0 : is log target index
00367  */
00368 static int lov_set_osc_active(struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *uuid,
00369                               enum obd_notify_event ev)
00370 {
00371         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00372         struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt;
00373         int index, activate, active;
00374         ENTRY;
00375 
00376         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Searching in lov %p for uuid %s event(%d)\n",
00377                lov, uuid->uuid, ev);
00378 
00379         obd_getref(obd);
00380         for (index = 0; index < lov->desc.ld_tgt_count; index++) {
00381                 tgt = lov->lov_tgts[index];
00382                 if (!tgt)
00383                         continue;
00384                 /*
00385                  * LU-642, initially inactive OSC could miss the obd_connect,
00386                  * we make up for it here.
00387                  */
00388                 if (ev == OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVATE && tgt->ltd_exp == NULL &&
00389                     obd_uuid_equals(uuid, &tgt->ltd_uuid)) {
00390                         struct obd_uuid lov_osc_uuid = {"LOV_OSC_UUID"};
00391 
00392                         obd_connect(NULL, &tgt->ltd_exp, tgt->ltd_obd,
00393                                     &lov_osc_uuid, &lov->lov_ocd, NULL);
00394                 }
00395                 if (!tgt->ltd_exp)
00396                         continue;
00397 
00398                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "lov idx %d is %s conn "LPX64"\n",
00399                        index, obd_uuid2str(&tgt->ltd_uuid),
00400                        tgt->ltd_exp->exp_handle.h_cookie);
00401                 if (obd_uuid_equals(uuid, &tgt->ltd_uuid))
00402                         break;
00403         }
00404 
00405         if (index == lov->desc.ld_tgt_count)
00406                 GOTO(out, index = -EINVAL);
00407 
00408         if (ev == OBD_NOTIFY_DEACTIVATE || ev == OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVATE) {
00409                 activate = (ev == OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVATE) ? 1 : 0;
00410 
00411                 if (lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_activate == activate) {
00412                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "OSC %s already %sactivate!\n",
00413                                uuid->uuid, activate ? "" : "de");
00414                 } else {
00415                         lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_activate = activate;
00416                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "%sactivate OSC %s\n",
00417                                activate ? "" : "de", obd_uuid2str(uuid));
00418                 }
00419 
00420         } else if (ev == OBD_NOTIFY_INACTIVE || ev == OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVE) {
00421                 active = (ev == OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVE) ? 1 : 0;
00422 
00423                 if (lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_active == active) {
00424                         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "OSC %s already %sactive!\n",
00425                                uuid->uuid, active ? "" : "in");
00426                         GOTO(out, index);
00427                 } else {
00428                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Marking OSC %s %sactive\n",
00429                                obd_uuid2str(uuid), active ? "" : "in");
00430                 }
00431 
00432                 lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_active = active;
00433                 if (active) {
00434                         lov->desc.ld_active_tgt_count++;
00435                         lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_exp->exp_obd->obd_inactive = 0;
00436                 } else {
00437                         lov->desc.ld_active_tgt_count--;
00438                         lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_exp->exp_obd->obd_inactive = 1;
00439                 }
00440         } else {
00441                 CERROR("%s: unknown event %d for uuid %s\n", obd->obd_name,
00442                        ev, uuid->uuid);
00443         }
00444 
00445  out:
00446         obd_putref(obd);
00447         RETURN(index);
00448 }
00449 
00450 static int lov_notify(struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_device *watched,
00451                       enum obd_notify_event ev, void *data)
00452 {
00453         int rc = 0;
00454         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00455         ENTRY;
00456 
00457         down_read(&lov->lov_notify_lock);
00458         if (!lov->lov_connects) {
00459                 up_read(&lov->lov_notify_lock);
00460                 RETURN(rc);
00461         }
00462 
00463         if (ev == OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVE || ev == OBD_NOTIFY_INACTIVE ||
00464             ev == OBD_NOTIFY_ACTIVATE || ev == OBD_NOTIFY_DEACTIVATE) {
00465                 struct obd_uuid *uuid;
00466 
00467                 LASSERT(watched);
00468 
00469                 if (strcmp(watched->obd_type->typ_name, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME)) {
00470                         up_read(&lov->lov_notify_lock);
00471                         CERROR("unexpected notification of %s %s!\n",
00472                                watched->obd_type->typ_name,
00473                                watched->obd_name);
00474                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00475                 }
00476                 uuid = &watched->u.cli.cl_target_uuid;
00477 
00478                 /* Set OSC as active before notifying the observer, so the
00479                  * observer can use the OSC normally.
00480                  */
00481                 rc = lov_set_osc_active(obd, uuid, ev);
00482                 if (rc < 0) {
00483                         up_read(&lov->lov_notify_lock);
00484                         CERROR("event(%d) of %s failed: %d\n", ev,
00485                                obd_uuid2str(uuid), rc);
00486                         RETURN(rc);
00487                 }
00488                 /* active event should be pass lov target index as data */
00489                 data = &rc;
00490         }
00491 
00492         /* Pass the notification up the chain. */
00493         if (watched) {
00494                 rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, watched, ev, data);
00495         } else {
00496                 /* NULL watched means all osc's in the lov (only for syncs) */
00497                 /* sync event should be send lov idx as data */
00498                 struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00499                 int i, is_sync;
00500 
00501                 data = &i;
00502                 is_sync = (ev == OBD_NOTIFY_SYNC) ||
00503                           (ev == OBD_NOTIFY_SYNC_NONBLOCK);
00504 
00505                 obd_getref(obd);
00506                 for (i = 0; i < lov->desc.ld_tgt_count; i++) {
00507                         if (!lov->lov_tgts[i])
00508                                 continue;
00509 
00510                         /* don't send sync event if target not
00511                          * connected/activated */
00512                         if (is_sync &&  !lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_active)
00513                                 continue;
00514 
00515                         rc = obd_notify_observer(obd, lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_obd,
00516                                                  ev, data);
00517                         if (rc) {
00518                                 CERROR("%s: notify %s of %s failed %d\n",
00519                                        obd->obd_name,
00520                                        obd->obd_observer->obd_name,
00521                                        lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_obd->obd_name,
00522                                        rc);
00523                         }
00524                 }
00525                 obd_putref(obd);
00526         }
00527 
00528         up_read(&lov->lov_notify_lock);
00529         RETURN(rc);
00530 }
00531 
00532 static int lov_add_target(struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_uuid *uuidp,
00533                           __u32 index, int gen, int active)
00534 {
00535         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00536         struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt;
00537         struct obd_device *tgt_obd;
00538         int rc;
00539         ENTRY;
00540 
00541         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "uuid:%s idx:%d gen:%d active:%d\n",
00542                uuidp->uuid, index, gen, active);
00543 
00544         if (gen <= 0) {
00545                 CERROR("request to add OBD %s with invalid generation: %d\n",
00546                        uuidp->uuid, gen);
00547                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00548         }
00549 
00550         tgt_obd = class_find_client_obd(uuidp, LUSTRE_OSC_NAME,
00551                                         &obd->obd_uuid);
00552         if (tgt_obd == NULL)
00553                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00554 
00555         mutex_lock(&lov->lov_lock);
00556 
00557         if ((index < lov->lov_tgt_size) && (lov->lov_tgts[index] != NULL)) {
00558                 tgt = lov->lov_tgts[index];
00559                 CERROR("UUID %s already assigned at LOV target index %d\n",
00560                        obd_uuid2str(&tgt->ltd_uuid), index);
00561                 mutex_unlock(&lov->lov_lock);
00562                 RETURN(-EEXIST);
00563         }
00564 
00565         if (index >= lov->lov_tgt_size) {
00566                 /* We need to reallocate the lov target array. */
00567                 struct lov_tgt_desc **newtgts, **old = NULL;
00568                 __u32 newsize, oldsize = 0;
00569 
00570                 newsize = max(lov->lov_tgt_size, (__u32)2);
00571                 while (newsize < index + 1)
00572                         newsize = newsize << 1;
00573                 OBD_ALLOC(newtgts, sizeof(*newtgts) * newsize);
00574                 if (newtgts == NULL) {
00575                         mutex_unlock(&lov->lov_lock);
00576                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00577                 }
00578 
00579                 if (lov->lov_tgt_size) {
00580                         memcpy(newtgts, lov->lov_tgts, sizeof(*newtgts) *
00581                                lov->lov_tgt_size);
00582                         old = lov->lov_tgts;
00583                         oldsize = lov->lov_tgt_size;
00584                 }
00585 
00586                 lov->lov_tgts = newtgts;
00587                 lov->lov_tgt_size = newsize;
00588                 smp_rmb();
00589                 if (old)
00590                         OBD_FREE(old, sizeof(*old) * oldsize);
00591 
00592                 CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "tgts: %p size: %d\n",
00593                        lov->lov_tgts, lov->lov_tgt_size);
00594         }
00595 
00596         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(tgt);
00597         if (!tgt) {
00598                 mutex_unlock(&lov->lov_lock);
00599                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00600         }
00601 
00602         rc = lov_ost_pool_add(&lov->lov_packed, index, lov->lov_tgt_size);
00603         if (rc) {
00604                 mutex_unlock(&lov->lov_lock);
00605                 OBD_FREE_PTR(tgt);
00606                 RETURN(rc);
00607         }
00608 
00609         tgt->ltd_uuid = *uuidp;
00610         tgt->ltd_obd = tgt_obd;
00611         /* XXX - add a sanity check on the generation number. */
00612         tgt->ltd_gen = gen;
00613         tgt->ltd_index = index;
00614         tgt->ltd_activate = active;
00615         lov->lov_tgts[index] = tgt;
00616         if (index >= lov->desc.ld_tgt_count)
00617                 lov->desc.ld_tgt_count = index + 1;
00618 
00619         mutex_unlock(&lov->lov_lock);
00620 
00621         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "idx=%d ltd_gen=%d ld_tgt_count=%d\n",
00622                 index, tgt->ltd_gen, lov->desc.ld_tgt_count);
00623 
00624         rc = obd_notify(obd, tgt_obd, OBD_NOTIFY_CREATE, &index);
00625 
00626         if (lov->lov_connects == 0) {
00627                 /* lov_connect hasn't been called yet. We'll do the
00628                    lov_connect_obd on this target when that fn first runs,
00629                    because we don't know the connect flags yet. */
00630                 RETURN(0);
00631         }
00632 
00633         obd_getref(obd);
00634 
00635         rc = lov_connect_obd(obd, index, active, &lov->lov_ocd);
00636         if (rc)
00637                 GOTO(out, rc);
00638 
00639         /* connect to administrative disabled ost */
00640         if (!tgt->ltd_exp)
00641                 GOTO(out, rc = 0);
00642 
00643         if (lov->lov_cache != NULL) {
00644                 rc = obd_set_info_async(NULL, tgt->ltd_exp,
00645                                 sizeof(KEY_CACHE_SET), KEY_CACHE_SET,
00646                                 sizeof(struct cl_client_cache), lov->lov_cache,
00647                                 NULL);
00648                 if (rc < 0)
00649                         GOTO(out, rc);
00650         }
00651 
00652         rc = lov_notify(obd, tgt->ltd_exp->exp_obd,
00653                         active ? OBD_NOTIFY_CONNECT : OBD_NOTIFY_INACTIVE,
00654                         (void *)&index);
00655 
00656 out:
00657         if (rc) {
00658                 CERROR("add failed (%d), deleting %s\n", rc,
00659                        obd_uuid2str(&tgt->ltd_uuid));
00660                 lov_del_target(obd, index, NULL, 0);
00661         }
00662         obd_putref(obd);
00663         RETURN(rc);
00664 }
00665 
00666 /* Schedule a target for deletion */
00667 int lov_del_target(struct obd_device *obd, __u32 index,
00668                    struct obd_uuid *uuidp, int gen)
00669 {
00670         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00671         int count = lov->desc.ld_tgt_count;
00672         int rc = 0;
00673         ENTRY;
00674 
00675         if (index >= count) {
00676                 CERROR("LOV target index %d >= number of LOV OBDs %d.\n",
00677                        index, count);
00678                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00679         }
00680 
00681         /* to make sure there's no ongoing lov_notify() now */
00682         down_write(&lov->lov_notify_lock);
00683         obd_getref(obd);
00684 
00685         if (!lov->lov_tgts[index]) {
00686                 CERROR("LOV target at index %d is not setup.\n", index);
00687                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00688         }
00689 
00690         if (uuidp && !obd_uuid_equals(uuidp, &lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_uuid)) {
00691                 CERROR("LOV target UUID %s at index %d doesn't match %s.\n",
00692                        lov_uuid2str(lov, index), index,
00693                        obd_uuid2str(uuidp));
00694                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00695         }
00696 
00697         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "uuid: %s idx: %d gen: %d exp: %p active: %d\n",
00698                lov_uuid2str(lov, index), index,
00699                lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_gen, lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_exp,
00700                lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_active);
00701 
00702         lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_reap = 1;
00703         lov->lov_death_row++;
00704         /* we really delete it from obd_putref */
00705 out:
00706         obd_putref(obd);
00707         up_write(&lov->lov_notify_lock);
00708 
00709         RETURN(rc);
00710 }
00711 
00712 static void __lov_del_obd(struct obd_device *obd, struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt)
00713 {
00714         struct obd_device *osc_obd;
00715 
00716         LASSERT(tgt);
00717         LASSERT(tgt->ltd_reap);
00718 
00719         osc_obd = class_exp2obd(tgt->ltd_exp);
00720 
00721         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "Removing tgt %s : %s\n",
00722                tgt->ltd_uuid.uuid,
00723                osc_obd ? osc_obd->obd_name : "<no obd>");
00724 
00725         if (tgt->ltd_exp)
00726                 lov_disconnect_obd(obd, tgt);
00727 
00728         OBD_FREE_PTR(tgt);
00729 
00730         /* Manual cleanup - no cleanup logs to clean up the osc's.  We must
00731            do it ourselves. And we can't do it from lov_cleanup,
00732            because we just lost our only reference to it. */
00733         if (osc_obd)
00734                 class_manual_cleanup(osc_obd);
00735 }
00736 
00737 void lov_fix_desc_stripe_size(__u64 *val)
00738 {
00739         if (*val < LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE) {
00740                 if (*val != 0)
00741                         LCONSOLE_INFO("Increasing default stripe size to "
00742                                       "minimum %u\n",
00743                                       LOV_DESC_STRIPE_SIZE_DEFAULT);
00744                 *val = LOV_DESC_STRIPE_SIZE_DEFAULT;
00745         } else if (*val & (LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE - 1)) {
00746                 *val &= ~(LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE - 1);
00747                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Changing default stripe size to "LPU64" (a "
00748                               "multiple of %u)\n",
00749                               *val, LOV_MIN_STRIPE_SIZE);
00750         }
00751 }
00752 
00753 void lov_fix_desc_stripe_count(__u32 *val)
00754 {
00755         if (*val == 0)
00756                 *val = 1;
00757 }
00758 
00759 void lov_fix_desc_pattern(__u32 *val)
00760 {
00761         /* from lov_setstripe */
00762         if ((*val != 0) && (*val != LOV_PATTERN_RAID0)) {
00763                 LCONSOLE_WARN("Unknown stripe pattern: %#x\n", *val);
00764                 *val = 0;
00765         }
00766 }
00767 
00768 void lov_fix_desc_qos_maxage(__u32 *val)
00769 {
00770         if (*val == 0)
00771                 *val = LOV_DESC_QOS_MAXAGE_DEFAULT;
00772 }
00773 
00774 void lov_fix_desc(struct lov_desc *desc)
00775 {
00776         lov_fix_desc_stripe_size(&desc->ld_default_stripe_size);
00777         lov_fix_desc_stripe_count(&desc->ld_default_stripe_count);
00778         lov_fix_desc_pattern(&desc->ld_pattern);
00779         lov_fix_desc_qos_maxage(&desc->ld_qos_maxage);
00780 }
00781 
00782 int lov_setup(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg)
00783 {
00784         struct lov_desc *desc;
00785         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00786 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00787         struct obd_type *type;
00788 #endif
00789         int rc;
00790         ENTRY;
00791 
00792         if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) < 1) {
00793                 CERROR("LOV setup requires a descriptor\n");
00794                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00795         }
00796 
00797         desc = (struct lov_desc *)lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1);
00798 
00799         if (sizeof(*desc) > LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1)) {
00800                 CERROR("descriptor size wrong: %d > %d\n",
00801                        (int)sizeof(*desc), LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1));
00802                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
00803         }
00804 
00805         if (desc->ld_magic != LOV_DESC_MAGIC) {
00806                 if (desc->ld_magic == __swab32(LOV_DESC_MAGIC)) {
00807                             CDEBUG(D_OTHER, "%s: Swabbing lov desc %p\n",
00808                                    obd->obd_name, desc);
00809                             lustre_swab_lov_desc(desc);
00810                 } else {
00811                         CERROR("%s: Bad lov desc magic: %#x\n",
00812                                obd->obd_name, desc->ld_magic);
00813                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
00814                 }
00815         }
00816 
00817         lov_fix_desc(desc);
00818 
00819         desc->ld_active_tgt_count = 0;
00820         lov->desc = *desc;
00821         lov->lov_tgt_size = 0;
00822 
00823         mutex_init(&lov->lov_lock);
00824         atomic_set(&lov->lov_refcount, 0);
00825         lov->lov_sp_me = LUSTRE_SP_CLI;
00826 
00827         init_rwsem(&lov->lov_notify_lock);
00828 
00829         lov->lov_pools_hash_body = cfs_hash_create("POOLS", HASH_POOLS_CUR_BITS,
00830                                                    HASH_POOLS_MAX_BITS,
00831                                                    HASH_POOLS_BKT_BITS, 0,
00832                                                    CFS_HASH_MIN_THETA,
00833                                                    CFS_HASH_MAX_THETA,
00834                                                    &pool_hash_operations,
00835                                                    CFS_HASH_DEFAULT);
00836         INIT_LIST_HEAD(&lov->lov_pool_list);
00837         lov->lov_pool_count = 0;
00838         rc = lov_ost_pool_init(&lov->lov_packed, 0);
00839         if (rc)
00840                 GOTO(out, rc);
00841 
00842 #ifdef CONFIG_PROC_FS
00843         obd->obd_vars = lprocfs_lov_obd_vars;
00844         /* If this is true then both client (lov) and server
00845          * (lod) are on the same node. The lod layer if loaded
00846          * first will register the lov proc directory. In that
00847          * case obd->obd_type->typ_procroot will be not set.
00848          * Instead we use type->typ_procsym as the parent. */
00849         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_LOD_NAME);
00850         if (type != NULL && type->typ_procsym != NULL) {
00851                 obd->obd_proc_entry = lprocfs_register(obd->obd_name,
00852                                                        type->typ_procsym,
00853                                                        obd->obd_vars, obd);
00854                 if (IS_ERR(obd->obd_proc_entry)) {
00855                         rc = PTR_ERR(obd->obd_proc_entry);
00856                         CERROR("error %d setting up lprocfs for %s\n", rc,
00857                                obd->obd_name);
00858                         obd->obd_proc_entry = NULL;
00859                 }
00860         } else {
00861                 rc = lprocfs_obd_setup(obd);
00862         }
00863 
00864         if (rc == 0) {
00865                 rc = lprocfs_seq_create(obd->obd_proc_entry, "target_obd",
00866                                         0444, &lov_proc_target_fops, obd);
00867                 if (rc)
00868                         CWARN("Error adding the target_obd file\n");
00869 
00870                 lov->lov_pool_proc_entry = lprocfs_register("pools",
00871                                                             obd->obd_proc_entry,
00872                                                             NULL, NULL);
00873                 if (IS_ERR(lov->lov_pool_proc_entry)) {
00874                         rc = PTR_ERR(lov->lov_pool_proc_entry);
00875                         CERROR("error %d setting up lprocfs for pools\n", rc);
00876                         lov->lov_pool_proc_entry = NULL;
00877                 }
00878         }
00879 #endif
00880         RETURN(0);
00881 
00882 out:
00883         return rc;
00884 }
00885 
00886 static int lov_cleanup(struct obd_device *obd)
00887 {
00888         struct lov_obd *lov = &obd->u.lov;
00889         struct list_head *pos, *tmp;
00890         struct pool_desc *pool;
00891         ENTRY;
00892 
00893         list_for_each_safe(pos, tmp, &lov->lov_pool_list) {
00894                 pool = list_entry(pos, struct pool_desc, pool_list);
00895                 /* free pool structs */
00896                 CDEBUG(D_INFO, "delete pool %p\n", pool);
00897                 /* In the function below, .hs_keycmp resolves to
00898                  * pool_hashkey_keycmp() */
00899                 /* coverity[overrun-buffer-val] */
00900                 lov_pool_del(obd, pool->pool_name);
00901         }
00902         cfs_hash_putref(lov->lov_pools_hash_body);
00903         lov_ost_pool_free(&lov->lov_packed);
00904 
00905         lprocfs_obd_cleanup(obd);
00906         if (lov->lov_tgts) {
00907                 int i;
00908                 obd_getref(obd);
00909                 for (i = 0; i < lov->desc.ld_tgt_count; i++) {
00910                         if (!lov->lov_tgts[i])
00911                                 continue;
00912 
00913                         /* Inactive targets may never have connected */
00914                         if (lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_active ||
00915                             atomic_read(&lov->lov_refcount))
00916                                 /* We should never get here - these
00917                                  * should have been removed in the
00918                                  * disconnect. */
00919                                 CERROR("%s: lov tgt %d not cleaned! "
00920                                        "deathrow=%d, lovrc=%d\n",
00921                                        obd->obd_name, i, lov->lov_death_row,
00922                                        atomic_read(&lov->lov_refcount));
00923                         lov_del_target(obd, i, NULL, 0);
00924                 }
00925                 obd_putref(obd);
00926                 OBD_FREE(lov->lov_tgts, sizeof(*lov->lov_tgts) *
00927                          lov->lov_tgt_size);
00928                 lov->lov_tgt_size = 0;
00929         }
00930 
00931         if (lov->lov_cache != NULL) {
00932                 cl_cache_decref(lov->lov_cache);
00933                 lov->lov_cache = NULL;
00934         }
00935 
00936         RETURN(0);
00937 }
00938 
00939 int lov_process_config_base(struct obd_device *obd, struct lustre_cfg *lcfg,
00940                             __u32 *indexp, int *genp)
00941 {
00942         struct obd_uuid obd_uuid;
00943         int cmd;
00944         int rc = 0;
00945         ENTRY;
00946 
00947         switch(cmd = lcfg->lcfg_command) {
00948         case LCFG_LOV_ADD_OBD:
00949         case LCFG_LOV_ADD_INA:
00950         case LCFG_LOV_DEL_OBD: {
00951                 __u32 index;
00952                 int gen;
00953                 /* lov_modify_tgts add  0:lov_mdsA  1:ost1_UUID  2:0  3:1 */
00954                 if (LUSTRE_CFG_BUFLEN(lcfg, 1) > sizeof(obd_uuid.uuid))
00955                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00956 
00957                 obd_str2uuid(&obd_uuid,  lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 1));
00958 
00959                 if (sscanf(lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 2), "%u", indexp) != 1)
00960                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00961                 if (sscanf(lustre_cfg_buf(lcfg, 3), "%d", genp) != 1)
00962                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00963                 index = *indexp;
00964                 gen = *genp;
00965                 if (cmd == LCFG_LOV_ADD_OBD)
00966                         rc = lov_add_target(obd, &obd_uuid, index, gen, 1);
00967                 else if (cmd == LCFG_LOV_ADD_INA)
00968                         rc = lov_add_target(obd, &obd_uuid, index, gen, 0);
00969                 else
00970                         rc = lov_del_target(obd, index, &obd_uuid, gen);
00971                 GOTO(out, rc);
00972         }
00973         case LCFG_PARAM: {
00974                 struct lov_desc *desc = &(obd->u.lov.desc);
00975 
00976                 if (!desc)
00977                         GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00978 
00979                 rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_LOV, obd->obd_vars,
00980                                               lcfg, obd);
00981                 if (rc > 0)
00982                         rc = 0;
00983                 GOTO(out, rc);
00984         }
00985         case LCFG_POOL_NEW:
00986         case LCFG_POOL_ADD:
00987         case LCFG_POOL_DEL:
00988         case LCFG_POOL_REM:
00989                 GOTO(out, rc);
00990 
00991         default: {
00992                 CERROR("Unknown command: %d\n", lcfg->lcfg_command);
00993                 GOTO(out, rc = -EINVAL);
00994 
00995         }
00996         }
00997 out:
00998         RETURN(rc);
00999 }
01000 
01001 int lov_statfs_interpret(struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset, void *data, int rc)
01002 {
01003         struct lov_request_set *lovset = (struct lov_request_set *)data;
01004         int err;
01005         ENTRY;
01006 
01007         if (rc)
01008                 atomic_set(&lovset->set_completes, 0);
01009 
01010         err = lov_fini_statfs_set(lovset);
01011         RETURN(rc ? rc : err);
01012 }
01013 
01014 static int lov_statfs_async(struct obd_export *exp, struct obd_info *oinfo,
01015                             __u64 max_age, struct ptlrpc_request_set *rqset)
01016 {
01017         struct obd_device      *obd = class_exp2obd(exp);
01018         struct lov_request_set *set;
01019         struct lov_request *req;
01020         struct list_head *pos;
01021         struct lov_obd *lov;
01022         int rc = 0;
01023         ENTRY;
01024 
01025         LASSERT(oinfo != NULL);
01026         LASSERT(oinfo->oi_osfs != NULL);
01027 
01028         lov = &obd->u.lov;
01029         rc = lov_prep_statfs_set(obd, oinfo, &set);
01030         if (rc)
01031                 RETURN(rc);
01032 
01033         list_for_each(pos, &set->set_list) {
01034                 req = list_entry(pos, struct lov_request, rq_link);
01035                 rc = obd_statfs_async(lov->lov_tgts[req->rq_idx]->ltd_exp,
01036                                       &req->rq_oi, max_age, rqset);
01037                 if (rc)
01038                         break;
01039         }
01040 
01041         if (rc || list_empty(&rqset->set_requests)) {
01042                 int err;
01043                 if (rc)
01044                         atomic_set(&set->set_completes, 0);
01045                 err = lov_fini_statfs_set(set);
01046                 RETURN(rc ? rc : err);
01047         }
01048 
01049         LASSERT(rqset->set_interpret == NULL);
01050         rqset->set_interpret = lov_statfs_interpret;
01051         rqset->set_arg = (void *)set;
01052         RETURN(0);
01053 }
01054 
01055 static int lov_statfs(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01056                       struct obd_statfs *osfs, __u64 max_age, __u32 flags)
01057 {
01058         struct ptlrpc_request_set *set = NULL;
01059         struct obd_info oinfo = {
01060                 .oi_osfs = osfs,
01061                 .oi_flags = flags,
01062         };
01063         int rc = 0;
01064 
01065         ENTRY;
01066 
01067         /* for obdclass we forbid using obd_statfs_rqset, but prefer using async
01068          * statfs requests */
01069         set = ptlrpc_prep_set();
01070         if (set == NULL)
01071                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01072 
01073         rc = lov_statfs_async(exp, &oinfo, max_age, set);
01074         if (rc == 0)
01075                 rc = ptlrpc_set_wait(set);
01076 
01077         ptlrpc_set_destroy(set);
01078 
01079         RETURN(rc);
01080 }
01081 
01082 static int lov_iocontrol(unsigned int cmd, struct obd_export *exp, int len,
01083                          void *karg, void __user *uarg)
01084 {
01085         struct obd_device *obddev = class_exp2obd(exp);
01086         struct lov_obd *lov = &obddev->u.lov;
01087         int i = 0, rc = 0, count = lov->desc.ld_tgt_count;
01088         struct obd_uuid *uuidp;
01089         ENTRY;
01090 
01091         switch (cmd) {
01092         case IOC_OBD_STATFS: {
01093                 struct obd_ioctl_data *data = karg;
01094                 struct obd_device *osc_obd;
01095                 struct obd_statfs stat_buf = {0};
01096                 __u32 index;
01097                 __u32 flags;
01098 
01099                 memcpy(&index, data->ioc_inlbuf2, sizeof(index));
01100                 if ((index >= count))
01101                         RETURN(-ENODEV);
01102 
01103                 if (!lov->lov_tgts[index])
01104                         /* Try again with the next index */
01105                         RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01106                 if (!lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_active)
01107                         RETURN(-ENODATA);
01108 
01109                 osc_obd = class_exp2obd(lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_exp);
01110                 if (!osc_obd)
01111                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01112 
01113                 /* copy UUID */
01114                 if (copy_to_user(data->ioc_pbuf2, obd2cli_tgt(osc_obd),
01115                                  min_t(unsigned long, data->ioc_plen2,
01116                                        sizeof(struct obd_uuid))))
01117                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01118 
01119                 memcpy(&flags, data->ioc_inlbuf1, sizeof(flags));
01120                 flags = flags & LL_STATFS_NODELAY ? OBD_STATFS_NODELAY : 0;
01121 
01122                 /* got statfs data */
01123                 rc = obd_statfs(NULL, lov->lov_tgts[index]->ltd_exp, &stat_buf,
01124                                 cfs_time_shift_64(-OBD_STATFS_CACHE_SECONDS),
01125                                 flags);
01126                 if (rc)
01127                         RETURN(rc);
01128                 if (copy_to_user(data->ioc_pbuf1, &stat_buf,
01129                                  min_t(unsigned long, data->ioc_plen1,
01130                                        sizeof(struct obd_statfs))))
01131                         RETURN(-EFAULT);
01132                 break;
01133         }
01134         case OBD_IOC_LOV_GET_CONFIG: {
01135                 struct obd_ioctl_data *data;
01136                 struct lov_desc *desc;
01137                 char *buf = NULL;
01138                 __u32 *genp;
01139 
01140                 len = 0;
01141                 if (obd_ioctl_getdata(&buf, &len, uarg))
01142                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01143 
01144                 data = (struct obd_ioctl_data *)buf;
01145 
01146                 if (sizeof(*desc) > data->ioc_inllen1) {
01147                         obd_ioctl_freedata(buf, len);
01148                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01149                 }
01150 
01151                 if (sizeof(uuidp->uuid) * count > data->ioc_inllen2) {
01152                         obd_ioctl_freedata(buf, len);
01153                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01154                 }
01155 
01156                 if (sizeof(__u32) * count > data->ioc_inllen3) {
01157                         obd_ioctl_freedata(buf, len);
01158                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01159                 }
01160 
01161                 desc = (struct lov_desc *)data->ioc_inlbuf1;
01162                 memcpy(desc, &(lov->desc), sizeof(*desc));
01163 
01164                 uuidp = (struct obd_uuid *)data->ioc_inlbuf2;
01165                 genp = (__u32 *)data->ioc_inlbuf3;
01166                 /* the uuid will be empty for deleted OSTs */
01167                 for (i = 0; i < count; i++, uuidp++, genp++) {
01168                         if (!lov->lov_tgts[i])
01169                                 continue;
01170                         *uuidp = lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_uuid;
01171                         *genp = lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_gen;
01172                 }
01173 
01174                 if (copy_to_user(uarg, buf, len))
01175                         rc = -EFAULT;
01176                 obd_ioctl_freedata(buf, len);
01177                 break;
01178         }
01179         case OBD_IOC_QUOTACTL: {
01180                 struct if_quotactl *qctl = karg;
01181                 struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt = NULL;
01182                 struct obd_quotactl *oqctl;
01183 
01184                 if (qctl->qc_valid == QC_OSTIDX) {
01185                         if (count <= qctl->qc_idx)
01186                                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01187 
01188                         tgt = lov->lov_tgts[qctl->qc_idx];
01189                         if (!tgt || !tgt->ltd_exp)
01190                                 RETURN(-EINVAL);
01191                 } else if (qctl->qc_valid == QC_UUID) {
01192                         for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
01193                                 tgt = lov->lov_tgts[i];
01194                                 if (!tgt ||
01195                                     !obd_uuid_equals(&tgt->ltd_uuid,
01196                                                      &qctl->obd_uuid))
01197                                         continue;
01198 
01199                                 if (tgt->ltd_exp == NULL)
01200                                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01201 
01202                                 break;
01203                         }
01204                 } else {
01205                         RETURN(-EINVAL);
01206                 }
01207 
01208                 if (i >= count)
01209                         RETURN(-EAGAIN);
01210 
01211                 LASSERT(tgt && tgt->ltd_exp);
01212                 OBD_ALLOC_PTR(oqctl);
01213                 if (!oqctl)
01214                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01215 
01216                 QCTL_COPY(oqctl, qctl);
01217                 rc = obd_quotactl(tgt->ltd_exp, oqctl);
01218                 if (rc == 0) {
01219                         QCTL_COPY(qctl, oqctl);
01220                         qctl->qc_valid = QC_OSTIDX;
01221                         qctl->obd_uuid = tgt->ltd_uuid;
01222                 }
01223                 OBD_FREE_PTR(oqctl);
01224                 break;
01225         }
01226         default: {
01227                 int set = 0;
01228 
01229                 if (count == 0)
01230                         RETURN(-ENOTTY);
01231 
01232                 for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
01233                         int err;
01234                         struct obd_device *osc_obd;
01235 
01236                         /* OST was disconnected */
01237                         if (!lov->lov_tgts[i] || !lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_exp)
01238                                 continue;
01239 
01240                         /* ll_umount_begin() sets force flag but for lov, not
01241                          * osc. Let's pass it through */
01242                         osc_obd = class_exp2obd(lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_exp);
01243                         osc_obd->obd_force = obddev->obd_force;
01244                         err = obd_iocontrol(cmd, lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_exp,
01245                                             len, karg, uarg);
01246                         if (err) {
01247                                 if (lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_active) {
01248                                         CDEBUG(err == -ENOTTY ?
01249                                                D_IOCTL : D_WARNING,
01250                                                "iocontrol OSC %s on OST "
01251                                                "idx %d cmd %x: err = %d\n",
01252                                                lov_uuid2str(lov, i),
01253                                                i, cmd, err);
01254                                         if (!rc)
01255                                                 rc = err;
01256                                 }
01257                         } else {
01258                                 set = 1;
01259                         }
01260                 }
01261                 if (!set && !rc)
01262                         rc = -EIO;
01263         }
01264         }
01265 
01266         RETURN(rc);
01267 }
01268 
01269 static int lov_get_info(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01270                         __u32 keylen, void *key, __u32 *vallen, void *val)
01271 {
01272         struct obd_device *obddev = class_exp2obd(exp);
01273         struct lov_obd *lov = &obddev->u.lov;
01274         struct lov_desc *ld = &lov->desc;
01275         int rc = 0;
01276         ENTRY;
01277 
01278         if (vallen == NULL || val == NULL)
01279                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
01280 
01281         obd_getref(obddev);
01282 
01283         if (KEY_IS(KEY_MAX_EASIZE)) {
01284                 u32 max_stripe_count = min_t(u32, ld->ld_active_tgt_count,
01285                                              LOV_MAX_STRIPE_COUNT);
01286 
01287                 *((u32 *)val) = lov_mds_md_size(max_stripe_count, LOV_MAGIC_V3);
01288         } else if (KEY_IS(KEY_DEFAULT_EASIZE)) {
01289                 u32 def_stripe_count = min_t(u32, ld->ld_default_stripe_count,
01290                                              LOV_MAX_STRIPE_COUNT);
01291 
01292                 *((u32 *)val) = lov_mds_md_size(def_stripe_count, LOV_MAGIC_V3);
01293         } else if (KEY_IS(KEY_TGT_COUNT)) {
01294                 *((int *)val) = lov->desc.ld_tgt_count;
01295         } else {
01296                 rc = -EINVAL;
01297         }
01298 
01299         obd_putref(obddev);
01300 
01301         RETURN(rc);
01302 }
01303 
01304 static int lov_set_info_async(const struct lu_env *env, struct obd_export *exp,
01305                               __u32 keylen, void *key,
01306                               __u32 vallen, void *val,
01307                               struct ptlrpc_request_set *set)
01308 {
01309         struct obd_device *obddev = class_exp2obd(exp);
01310         struct lov_obd *lov = &obddev->u.lov;
01311         struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt;
01312         int do_inactive = 0;
01313         int no_set = 0;
01314         u32 count;
01315         u32 i;
01316         int rc = 0;
01317         int err;
01318         ENTRY;
01319 
01320         if (set == NULL) {
01321                 no_set = 1;
01322                 set = ptlrpc_prep_set();
01323                 if (!set)
01324                         RETURN(-ENOMEM);
01325         }
01326 
01327         obd_getref(obddev);
01328         count = lov->desc.ld_tgt_count;
01329 
01330         if (KEY_IS(KEY_CHECKSUM)) {
01331                 do_inactive = 1;
01332         } else if (KEY_IS(KEY_CACHE_SET)) {
01333                 LASSERT(lov->lov_cache == NULL);
01334                 lov->lov_cache = val;
01335                 do_inactive = 1;
01336                 cl_cache_incref(lov->lov_cache);
01337         }
01338 
01339         for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
01340                 tgt = lov->lov_tgts[i];
01341 
01342                 /* OST was disconnected */
01343                 if (!tgt || !tgt->ltd_exp)
01344                         continue;
01345 
01346                 /* OST is inactive and we don't want inactive OSCs */
01347                 if (!tgt->ltd_active && !do_inactive)
01348                         continue;
01349 
01350                 err = obd_set_info_async(env, tgt->ltd_exp, keylen, key,
01351                                          vallen, val, set);
01352                 if (!rc)
01353                         rc = err;
01354         }
01355 
01356         obd_putref(obddev);
01357         if (no_set) {
01358                 err = ptlrpc_set_wait(set);
01359                 if (!rc)
01360                         rc = err;
01361                 ptlrpc_set_destroy(set);
01362         }
01363         RETURN(rc);
01364 }
01365 
01366 void lov_stripe_lock(struct lov_stripe_md *md)
01367 __acquires(&md->lsm_lock)
01368 {
01369         LASSERT(md->lsm_lock_owner != current_pid());
01370         spin_lock(&md->lsm_lock);
01371         LASSERT(md->lsm_lock_owner == 0);
01372         md->lsm_lock_owner = current_pid();
01373 }
01374 
01375 void lov_stripe_unlock(struct lov_stripe_md *md)
01376 __releases(&md->lsm_lock)
01377 {
01378         LASSERT(md->lsm_lock_owner == current_pid());
01379         md->lsm_lock_owner = 0;
01380         spin_unlock(&md->lsm_lock);
01381 }
01382 
01383 static int lov_quotactl(struct obd_device *obd, struct obd_export *exp,
01384                         struct obd_quotactl *oqctl)
01385 {
01386         struct lov_obd      *lov = &obd->u.lov;
01387         struct lov_tgt_desc *tgt;
01388         __u64                curspace = 0;
01389         __u64                bhardlimit = 0;
01390         int                  i, rc = 0;
01391         ENTRY;
01392 
01393         if (oqctl->qc_cmd != Q_GETOQUOTA &&
01394             oqctl->qc_cmd != LUSTRE_Q_SETQUOTA) {
01395                 CERROR("%s: bad quota opc %x for lov obd\n",
01396                        obd->obd_name, oqctl->qc_cmd);
01397                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
01398         }
01399 
01400         /* for lov tgt */
01401         obd_getref(obd);
01402         for (i = 0; i < lov->desc.ld_tgt_count; i++) {
01403                 int err;
01404 
01405                 tgt = lov->lov_tgts[i];
01406 
01407                 if (!tgt)
01408                         continue;
01409 
01410                 if (!tgt->ltd_active || tgt->ltd_reap) {
01411                         if (oqctl->qc_cmd == Q_GETOQUOTA &&
01412                             lov->lov_tgts[i]->ltd_activate) {
01413                                 rc = -ENETDOWN;
01414                                 CERROR("ost %d is inactive\n", i);
01415                         } else {
01416                                 CDEBUG(D_HA, "ost %d is inactive\n", i);
01417                         }
01418                         continue;
01419                 }
01420 
01421                 err = obd_quotactl(tgt->ltd_exp, oqctl);
01422                 if (err) {
01423                         if (tgt->ltd_active && !rc)
01424                                 rc = err;
01425                         continue;
01426                 }
01427 
01428                 if (oqctl->qc_cmd == Q_GETOQUOTA) {
01429                         curspace += oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_curspace;
01430                         bhardlimit += oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_bhardlimit;
01431                 }
01432         }
01433         obd_putref(obd);
01434 
01435         if (oqctl->qc_cmd == Q_GETOQUOTA) {
01436                 oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_curspace = curspace;
01437                 oqctl->qc_dqblk.dqb_bhardlimit = bhardlimit;
01438         }
01439         RETURN(rc);
01440 }

01442 static struct obd_ops lov_obd_ops = {
01443         .o_owner                = THIS_MODULE,
01444         .o_setup                = lov_setup,
01445         .o_cleanup              = lov_cleanup,
01446         .o_connect              = lov_connect,
01447         .o_disconnect           = lov_disconnect,
01448         .o_statfs               = lov_statfs,
01449         .o_statfs_async         = lov_statfs_async,
01450         .o_iocontrol            = lov_iocontrol,
01451         .o_get_info             = lov_get_info,
01452         .o_set_info_async       = lov_set_info_async,
01453         .o_notify               = lov_notify,
01454         .o_pool_new             = lov_pool_new,
01455         .o_pool_rem             = lov_pool_remove,
01456         .o_pool_add             = lov_pool_add,
01457         .o_pool_del             = lov_pool_del,
01458         .o_getref               = lov_getref,
01459         .o_putref               = lov_putref,
01460         .o_quotactl             = lov_quotactl,
01461 };
01462 
01463 struct kmem_cache *lov_oinfo_slab;
01464 
01465 static int __init lov_init(void)
01466 {
01467         bool enable_proc = true;
01468         struct obd_type *type;
01469         int rc;
01470         ENTRY;
01471 
01472         /* print an address of _any_ initialized kernel symbol from this
01473          * module, to allow debugging with gdb that doesn't support data
01474          * symbols from modules.*/
01475         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "Lustre LOV module (%p).\n", &lov_caches);
01476 
01477         rc = lu_kmem_init(lov_caches);
01478         if (rc)
01479                 return rc;
01480 
01481         lov_oinfo_slab = kmem_cache_create("lov_oinfo",
01482                                            sizeof(struct lov_oinfo), 0,
01483                                            SLAB_HWCACHE_ALIGN, NULL);
01484         if (lov_oinfo_slab == NULL) {
01485                 lu_kmem_fini(lov_caches);
01486                 return -ENOMEM;
01487         }
01488 
01489         type = class_search_type(LUSTRE_LOD_NAME);
01490         if (type != NULL && type->typ_procsym != NULL)
01491                 enable_proc = false;
01492 
01493         rc = class_register_type(&lov_obd_ops, NULL, enable_proc, NULL,
01494                                  LUSTRE_LOV_NAME, &lov_device_type);
01495 
01496         if (rc) {
01497                 kmem_cache_destroy(lov_oinfo_slab);
01498                 lu_kmem_fini(lov_caches);
01499         }
01500 
01501         RETURN(rc);
01502 }
01503 
01504 static void __exit lov_exit(void)
01505 {
01506         class_unregister_type(LUSTRE_LOV_NAME);
01507         kmem_cache_destroy(lov_oinfo_slab);
01508         lu_kmem_fini(lov_caches);
01509 }

01512 MODULE_DESCRIPTION("Lustre Logical Object Volume");
01513 MODULE_VERSION(LUSTRE_VERSION_STRING);
01514 MODULE_LICENSE("GPL");
01515 
01516 module_init(lov_init);
01517 module_exit(lov_exit);
